definition.name: Find unused Julia project dependencies
definition.description: Run a given test to see if any project dependencies are unused
definition.author: Ian Butterworth

inputs.name: test_code
inputs.description: Code to run while evaluating dependency usage

inputs.name: prefix
inputs.description: Value inserted in front of the julia command, e.g. for running xvfb-run julia [...]

inputs.name: project
inputs.description: Value passed to the --project flag. The default value is the repository root: "@."

inputs.name: fail_unused_direct_deps
inputs.description: Whether to fail the run if unused direct dependencies ar found. Default value: yes

inputs.name: fail_unused_indirect_deps
inputs.description: Whether to fail the run if unused direct dependencies ar found. Default value: no

steps.run:
# The Julia command that will be executed
julia_cmd=( julia --code-coverage=user --color=yes --project=${{ inputs.project }} -e '${{ inputs.test_code }}' )

# Add the prefix in front of the command if there is one
prefix="${{ inputs.prefix }}"
[[ -n $prefix ]] && julia_cmd=( "$prefix" "${julia_cmd[@]}" )

# Run the Julia command
"${julia_cmd[@]}"

evidence.reasoning: The action is designed to identify unused dependencies in a Julia project, which directly relates to code quality and dependency management. Additionally, it runs tests to evaluate the usage of these dependencies, linking it to testing as well.
